intro: Epitrachys serrulata, commonly known as the serrated epitrachys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Epitrachys serrulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
